name: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation
mission: PROVIDE SHELTER,CLOTHING,FOOD TO POOR AND THE NEEDY PEOPLE AROUND THE WORLD.
theoryOfChange: The website describes service delivery aimed at easing suffering through healthcare, education, and social welfare; examples include providing free treatment for those who cannot afford it, operating schools to break barriers to education, and welfare centers extending services to people at their door-steps.
zakatClaimEvidence: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc. is listed as "Zakat eligible". Their donation page explicitly offers a "Zakat" donation option. A PayPal donation page also states, "Use this donation for Zakat Sadaqah Donation". Furthermore, their website features a dedicated "Zakat" section and mentions "Edhi Foundation's Ramadan Zakat Appeal". (Source: https://edhi.org/albaraka-bank-pakistan-ltd/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: UNKNOWN (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 38/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc shows strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: The charity is Zakat-eligible and provides various methods for religious giving.
The organization reported total revenue of $5,752,945, a program expense ratio of 95.1%, and operates programs including the High Ways Project and ambulance services.
The foundation holds 120.5 months of working capital and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The charity earns a respectable score due to its extraordinary financial efficiency and deep alignment with religious giving priorities, though its overall impact score is moderated by a lack of cost-per-beneficiary data.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party impact verification data currently available for specific program outcomes.
High concentration of assets relative to annual spending may require clearer long-term deployment strategies.

dimension_explanations.alignment: This organization is Zakat-eligible and shows high donor fit for those seeking to support traditional Islamic humanitarian values [1]. Its long-standing track record in emergency relief and social welfare contributes to a high alignment score for religious and cultural cause urgency [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates strong financial health with a total revenue of $5,752,945 and a 95.1% program expense ratio [2][3]. While it provides direct services like ambulance and educational programs, the impact score reflects a need for more granular data on specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc provides a critical global safety net through high-efficiency humanitarian relief and emergency medical services.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 95.1%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need.
Robust financial stability with 120.5 months of working capital available to sustain operations.
Highly efficient fundraising model with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised.
baseline_narrative.summary: The organization is dedicated to providing shelter, clothing, and food to impoverished populations worldwide while maintaining a diverse array of social programs [2]. These initiatives include a specialized High Ways Project covering 25 kilometers, educational services, and an extensive ambulance network [2][3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The charity earns a respectable score due to its extraordinary financial efficiency and deep alignment with religious giving priorities, though its overall impact score is moderated by a lack of cost-per-beneficiary data.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization holds <cite id="7">$27.4 million in net assets</cite> relative to <cite id="15">$2.7 million in annual expenses</cite>, suggesting a need for a time-bound plan to deploy excess reserves into mission delivery.
While program ratios are high, there is <cite id="16">no publicly available beneficiary count</cite> to assess the cost-effectiveness per person served.

bbb_assessment.summary: BBB Wise Giving Alliance evaluation is not currently available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The foundation's massive asset base ensures it can survive significant economic downturns without cutting services.
risk_factors: <cite id="19">3-Year Revenue CAGR of -4.0%</cite> indicates a slight downward trend in funding.
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="11">excessive working capital</cite> which may indicate that funds are being accumulated rather than deployed to meet urgent needs.

confidence.notes: Financial data is highly consistent across sources.

alignment.explanation: The charity is a strong fit for Muslim donors as it <cite id="8">accepts zakat for the poor and needy</cite> and operates in <cite id="18">Muslim-majority regions</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust the foundation due to its <cite id="9">founding in 1949</cite> and its <cite id="14">Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>. Governance is overseen by a <cite id="13">95.1% independent board</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the foundation could <cite id="17">expand its board beyond 4 members</cite> to enhance diverse oversight.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="5">95.1% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="10">direct service delivery model</cite> that bypasses intermediaries.
impact.improvement: Impact assessment would benefit from <cite id="16">publishing consistent beneficiary data</cite> to calculate cost-per-outcome metrics.

rich_narrative.headline: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc provides a critical global safety net through high-efficiency humanitarian relief and emergency medical services.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value long-term institutional stability and want their zakat to support direct, high-efficiency emergency services in Pakistan.
donor_motivations: Want to support the legacy of Abdul Sattar Edhi
Prioritize organizations with zero fundraising costs
Value direct service delivery over advocacy
Seek to fulfill zakat obligations through established channels
giving_considerations: The organization holds very high reserves, meaning your gift adds to a large endowment
Focus is highly localized to Pakistan
Limited reporting on specific impact metrics per dollar
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fund small, agile startups or those requiring rigorous third-party impact evaluations like RCTs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects <cite id="20">verified outcomes</cite> and a strong theory of change, but lacks <cite id="16">independent beneficiary tracking</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The foundation utilizes a direct-action model to provide immediate relief (food, health, shelter) to reduce mortality and suffering among the destitute.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the vast ambulance and shelter network is effectively reaching the most vulnerable populations.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the charity has <cite id="7">significant assets</cite>, the <cite id="19">declining revenue trend</cite> suggests a need for continued donor support to maintain its massive infrastructure.

strengths.detail: The foundation directs <cite id="5">95.1% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, with a <cite id="6">fundraising cost of zero dollars</cite> per dollar raised.
Founded in <cite id="9">1949</cite>, the organization has over 75 years of experience in <cite id="10">direct service delivery</cite> across Pakistan.
The charity maintains <cite id="11">120.5 months of working capital</cite>, providing an extraordinary buffer for long-term operational sustainability.

strengths_deep_dive: The foundation's strength lies in its massive infrastructure for direct aid. It operates <cite id="3">specialized ambulance services</cite> and <cite id="12">hospitals</cite> that provide a critical safety net where government services are often absent. This direct delivery model is supported by a <cite id="13">95.1% independent board</cite>, ensuring that governance remains focused on the mission of serving the impoverished without internal conflicts of interest. Furthermore, the organization has achieved a <cite id="14">Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, reflecting a commitment to public disclosure of its financial and operational data.
rich_narrative.summary: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc serves as a vital humanitarian lifeline, continuing the legacy of its founder by providing <cite id="1">shelter, clothing, and food to the poor</cite> globally. Headquartered in New York to support operations primarily in Pakistan, the organization manages a sophisticated social safety net that includes <cite id="2">educational services, children's services, and orphanage centers</cite>. A cornerstone of their operational model is the <cite id="3">extensive ambulance network</cite>, which provides emergency medical transport to underserved populations. Financially, the foundation operates with a high degree of lean efficiency, reporting <cite id="4">$5,752,945 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Remarkably, the organization maintains a <cite id="5">95.1% program expense ratio</cite> according to recent filings, ensuring that every dollar of public support is directed toward direct service delivery. This efficiency is further bolstered by a <cite id="6">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, indicating that the foundation does not deplete its charitable pools to solicit further donations. While the organization holds significant <cite id="7">net assets of $27,402,805</cite>, it maintains a consistent focus on direct humanitarian aid, serving as a primary responder for <cite id="8">fuqara (the poor) and masakin (the needy)</cite> through its zakat-eligible programs.
